quote: Write the code as if it will be accompanied by a violent psychopath who knows where you live.
author: Stiv M.

quote: The complexity of the program grows until it exceeds the capabilities of the programmer.
author: Artur B.

quote: It's very easy to walk on water and develop programs following the TOR ... if they are frozen.
author: Berard I.

quote: Always write code as if it will be accompanied by a violent psychopath who knows where you live.
author: Martin G.

quote: Many of you are familiar with the virtues of a programmer. There are only three of them, and of course they are: laziness, impatience and pride.
author: Larry V.

quote: Don't worry if something doesn't work. If everything worked, you would be fired.
author: Valdi R.

quote: In good design, adding something costs less than the thing itself.
author: Tomas G.

quote: In theory, theory and practice are inseparable. In practice, they are not.
author: Yoggi B.

quote: Sometimes it's better to stay at home on a Monday night than spend an entire week debugging code written on Monday.
author: Kristofer T.

quote: Measuring a programmer's productivity by counting lines of code is like evaluating the construction of an airplane by its weight.
author: Bill G.
